website_summaries.verdict: A solid dental-health dog food with tooth-scraping chunks that are just large enough to convince small breeds to chew them.
pros: Puffy, chicken-flavored nuggets promote chewing to help eliminate plaque
Added antioxidants for immune system health
cons: Brewer’s rice, corn, and chicken by-product are the first 3 ingredients

customer_reviews.title: Great Product. Horrible Price.
customer_reviews.text: Love the product, hate the price! To get it from amazon.com is twice the price at many other stores I have recently discovered. I won't be ordering it from amazon.com in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Our Fur Baby LOVES these!!
customer_reviews.text: We have a very picky Shih Tzu. But she get even a whiff of these dental cubes & she goes crazy! She’s only 12lbs & has had 15 teeth removed so we want to retain as many of her remaining teeth as possible. She gets these as treats a few times per day.
customer_reviews.author: Ranman

customer_reviews.title: reliable customer service & and perfect quality product
customer_reviews.text: My two Pomeranian dogs love the Hills T/D dental health dog food. It is suppose to help keep my dogs teeth clean and prevent tartar and plaque build-up. A vet and some friends recommended it. It seems to be working for my dogs, and hopefully will keep working to help keep their teeth clean. The seller of the product shipped the product right away, and it arrived in perfect condition. I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Dale R. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: False Advertisement
customer_reviews.text: This dog food lead me to believe it was small bites. The pieces are more like the size of small rocks. Nothing small about them. I have two small dogs and the pieces are too big for their mouths. This is a case of false advertising. Now I’m stuck for $47 worth of dog food that my dogs can’t eat. What a rip off. I think I should be refunded the money for false advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Susan F

customer_reviews.title: These “small bites” are definitely not small by any means!!
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended this food after my dog had teeth and root canals once his mouth healed. I came home and ordered thIs. I wish I had read the reviews. The description is totally false in regards to small bites. There’s no was my Shih Tzu can eat this. They are the size of a bolder! The food is expensive and I paid for faster shipping so I’d have it. So now I have expensive food which my dog can’t eat, so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: These little nuggets really do help keep our two dogs' teeth clean and their breath not quite as horrid as usual!😝 These smaller ones are better for our little yorkies.
customer_reviews.author: David Hellberg

customer_reviews.title: Carly eats them!
customer_reviews.text: I got these fast. I break them in half for my pug Carly she had several teeth pulled and she likes these as her treat! She very very picky!
customer_reviews.author: OzzysGirl

customer_reviews.title: Too big for small dogs.
customer_reviews.text: This product is misleading. The size is too big too large to be called small bites. I have to smash it with s hammer for my Chihuahua.
customer_reviews.author: LisaBea

customer_reviews.title: Shhhhh...they're his "treats"
customer_reviews.text: Our dog loves these as special treats. Shhhhh....don't tell him it is just regular food and good for his teeth! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not small bites
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT SMALL BITES!!! At least not for a Yorkie-Maltese! He likes the taste and keeps wanting to eat it, but it takes him forever with each one because of his dental problems.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Costly but good product.
customer_reviews.text: Great product to help keep my Cockapoos teeth clean and she loves the taste. She will not touch the usual dental "Greenies" from the pet store.
customer_reviews.author: ppk49

customer_reviews.title: Bite sizes
customer_reviews.text: I wish it wasn’t quite so hard for them to chew it I have to cut it up and a couple pieces Could get stuck in their mouth as I have Yorkers!
customer_reviews.author: Little bear nation

customer_reviews.title: Vet gave us this idea. works well.
customer_reviews.text: We use this as a treat rather than regular diet. Yorkie thinks its yummy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was great!
customer_reviews.text: Bosco’s been on the at the vets recommendation .. glad to get it on line!
customer_reviews.author: catherine frey

customer_reviews.title: Tasty treat but really balanced nutrtion.
customer_reviews.text: This dog food was recommended by my Vet for Dental Health. My dogs loves it. I use it in there treat balls so it provides fun whie helping keep her teeth clean.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Wilson

customer_reviews.title: They're the perfect size for treats
customer_reviews.text: More important, my standard poodle loves these. They're the perfect size for treats!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy G

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product.. As described and fast shipping.. I would recomend
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for carrying, Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by our vet for after breakfast & dinner snack. We follow up with a chewy stick! Our dogs wait patiently for them--it's part of the routine!
customer_reviews.author: Chela

customer_reviews.title: Fraud, not what product claims to be
customer_reviews.text: Product not what it claims to be. Perhaps this batch was packaged incorrectly? They are the same size as the standard T/D and non-prescription Oral Care.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: What can I say other than the dog seemed happy.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond S. Flee

customer_reviews.title: Good Dog Food for Dogs with Teeth Cleaning Issues
customer_reviews.text: Great Dog food for treating Dog tartar and keeping the teeth clean.
customer_reviews.author: L. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: T/D Hills Science Diet
customer_reviews.text: Use this as treats to introduce enzymes to keep teeth clean and healthy
customer_reviews.author: Stephen D.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: A little big for my poodle mix, so give them to her in smaller pieces.
customer_reviews.author: P slater

customer_reviews.title: Don't recommend for small dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dog doesn't like the food at all. The kibbles are also quite large for a small dog (dachshund) which is coincidentally the dog pictured on the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel L Kranz

customer_reviews.title: Price should be under $20 otherwise you are getting ripped off
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy it unless it is around $20. This product is around that price for a 5lb bag. My bad for not looking it up (I paid over double that) buyer beware. My dog likes it, but this doesn't mean you can stop brushing your dogs teeth. The bites might be a little too big for a small chihuahua, but my mini Aussie has no problems crunching it.
customer_reviews.author: Violet

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this food and there teeth and gums are doing so much better...
customer_reviews.author: Angela Henne

customer_reviews.title: Trying to avoid my dog having to go under anasthetic ...
customer_reviews.text: Trying to avoid my dog having to go under anasthetic for teeth cleaning, hope it works!! Plus dont have to carry home heavy bag!!
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: Lola says not my taste.
customer_reviews.text: my dog doesn't like it. I wish she did. however, visiting dogs seem to love it.
customer_reviews.author: happyand73

customer_reviews.title: My Dog said "No Way"
customer_reviews.text: My little Diva Dog said "No Way Hosea....I ain't eating that!"
customer_reviews.author: Kay Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: They are supposed to be small bites but they are not, at least I don't think they are.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT AND PRICE
customer_reviews.text: MY HOLLY LOVES THESE. SHE HAS NEVER LET ME BRUSH HER TEETH SO THIS IS THE NEXT BEST THING POSSIBLE. ALSO ADD DROPS TO HER WATER THAT I ALSO PURCHASE FROM AMAZON. HALF THE PRICE OF THE VET.
customer_reviews.author: MARY JANE MUSCARELLA

customer_reviews.title: My dogs LOVE these!!!
customer_reviews.text: I agree with others, the price is crazy!!! BUT after having a $900 dollar dental bill for my rescue you had better believe i love these!! I use these for my dogs as treats and they love them!! Their teeth look great, no tarter and hopefully no more vet bills!! Just find a better price!!
customer_reviews.author: DJ Hueneburg

customer_reviews.title: Easiest way to keep your dog's teeth healthy!
customer_reviews.text: If your dog has tartar and plaque, this is the tasty solution for its removal! I've tried Greenies, brushing my dog's teeth, bones, etc. and then a friend told me this was how she keeps her dog's teeth so clean. I didn't really believe it would work on my dog, but I have been pleasantly surprised! He really likes the taste of the food. I don't even feed it as " regular" food--I just put a few in the bowl with his regular kibble with meals. And he likes the taste so well, that I can also use it as treats!
customer_reviews.author: T. Blagg

customer_reviews.title: I love this product which was recommended by my vet
customer_reviews.text: First, let me be clear, I love this product which was recommended by my vet. It does help our dogs dental care and we have used it for years. My comment here is that the price on Amazon is more than double what I can buy this product for at my vet (about $20). I have not, and would buy this product at this online price - makes no sense.
customer_reviews.author: Mountaingirl

customer_reviews.title: Choking hazard!
customer_reviews.text: These are not small bites! They are large and marble shaped, perfect for choking on. Our pug did choke on one, passed out, we couldn't dislodge it, so my wife push it further into her stomach and luckily saved our dog. It was traumatic to say the least. Be careful feeding this to a small dog.
customer_reviews.author: L. Macy

customer_reviews.title: overpriced
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this but it is way overpriced on amazon. I bought at my vet's office for $23.
customer_reviews.author: Audie Burns

customer_reviews.title: Way too expensive
customer_reviews.text: Great dog food, proven to help clean plaque. HOWEVER...way too expensive...why Amazon, quit ripping pet lovers off.
customer_reviews.author: Buckazoids

customer_reviews.title: OVERPRICED!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a 5 lb. bag at Petco and the price was $19.99. This is way too much to charge for a 5 lb. bag of food.
customer_reviews.author: pmb

customer_reviews.title: Great treat, but shop around
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these as treats. It is the only thing he has ever eaten while at the vet. I get this at the vet for $20, so shop around.
customer_reviews.author: wyplash

customer_reviews.title: These were recommended by vet for keeping dog's teeth clean and dog ...
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended by vet for keeping dog's teeth clean and dog does like them and they do seem to be working.
customer_reviews.author: Alf Lewis

product_meta.title: Hill'S Prescription Diet T/D Dental Health - Small Bites Dog Food (5 Lb)
product_meta.description:
dental health 

dental care for your pet may be more important than you think. The accumulation of bacteria laden plaque above the gumline can lead to long term oral health issues. Recent studies have demonstrated there is an Association between oral health issues and systemic general health issues affecting the kidney, heart and metabolic systems.

hill's nutritionists & veterinarians developed prescription diet t/D clinical Nutrition especially formulated to support your dog's Dental health. In fact, t/D small Bites is clinically proven nutrition to reduce plaque, stain, & tartar buildup in dogs weighing less than 10kg (22 lb).
feature_bullets: Defend cells from free radical oxidation, promoting a healthy immune system.
